title: Worked Example Learning Design for Enhancing Training Efficiency in Large-Scale Elderly Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of gerontological learning psychology and cognitive load theory, with foundational knowledge in instructional design
context.additional_context: Sociology undergraduate program practicing instructional methods for designing senior education programs, with project-based assessments measuring application capabilities

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three strategies to minimize cognitive load for elderly learners using the worked-example learning model.
Learners can derive five key considerations when designing training materials for older adults based on Cognitive Load Theory (CLT).
Learners can comparatively analyze the efficiency differences between worked-example learning and traditional problem-solving methods through project-based assessment.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
